sections.heading: What is ESI Registration?
content: Businesses in India must register for Employees' State Insurance (ESI) under the Employees' State Insurance Act, 1948. It provides medical care, sick leave, maternity leave, disability benefits, and financial support in case of death at work.
Companies meeting certain requirements must register with the Employees' State Insurance Corporation (ESIC) and make monthly contributions.

sections.heading: Who Needs to Sign Up for ESI?

points: Companies with 10 or more employees (20 in some states)
Employees earning ₹21,000 or less per month
All business types: companies, LLPs, partnerships, and sole proprietorships
Shops, factories, and other establishments
Once covered, ESI applies even if the number of employees drops below the threshold

subsections.title: For Employees
list: Free medical care for employees and families
Financial aid for dependents in case of employee death

points: Create an employer account on the ESIC portal using your PAN
Provide business, owner, and employee information
ESIC reviews the application and issues a 17-digit ESI Registration Number
Processing time: 7–15 business days
Employer contribution: 3.25% of employee wages
Employee contribution: 0.75% of wages
Rates are subject to government changes
Pay ESI contributions monthly by the 15th of the next month
File ESI returns twice a year
Maintain records of employee attendance and wages
Update employee information as needed
Interest charges for late payments
Fines
Legal action
Loss of benefits for employees
Do new businesses need ESI? Yes, if employee count and wages meet thresholds.
Can I register ESI on my own? Yes, if coverage requirements are met.
Are contract workers covered? Yes, temporary and contract workers are included.
What if an employee earns more than ₹21,000? They are usually not covered unless already enrolled.
Can employees opt out? No, coverage is mandatory once required.
What if employee count drops? Coverage continues regardless of reduction.
